title: Comparison and Application of Instructional Design Models: Dick & Carey vs. Morrison, Ross & Kemp

context.prior_knowledge: Completion of advanced studies and experience in executing high-level projects
context.additional_context: Project-based learning for pre-service teachers to comparatively analyze instructional design models in language education and apply them to real-world cases in VR simulation environments

learning_goals: Learners can explain the core stages and differences between the Dick & Carey model and the Morrison, Ross & Kemp model.
Analyze language education scenarios to select appropriate instructional design models and provide justification for their application.
Develop a language education simulation prototype by applying instructional design models in a VR environment.
Revise project deliverables based on peer feedback and evaluate the final output.

resources: Comparative Analysis of Instructional Design Models

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
